item.title: LatinXperiences Workshop
item.description:
LatinXperiences is an event that strives to create new and lasting connections between established researchers, at top-tier universities and research laboratories, and early-career researchers and students from Latin American countries.

There are thriving research and tech communities in Latin America that, for the most part, do not interact with the AAAI community. Our goal is to bring these communities together in a welcoming, social environment.

This workshop was one of the accepted diversity and inclusion activities at the AAAI-21 conference.

item.title: Panel Making a Career Transition Into Industry: Stories & Tips from Math, CS, and Stats Alumni
item.description: In this panel, alumni of graduate programs in mathematics, computer science, and statistics share how they successfully transitioned from academia into industrial positions in the areas of machine learning, AI, and data science. After learning from the story of each of our four panelists, we’ll have an extensive Q&A session.

item.title: 4th Mexican Mathematicians in the World Conference
item.description:
Role

  • Member of the scientific committee for the event 4th Mexican Mathematicians in the World
  • Lead organizer of the Panel - Intercambio, Mobilidad, and Reincorporación.
